title: Humble Bitcoiners
author: Humble Bitcoiners
created_time: February 07, 2023, 12:27:57 PMLast edit: February 08, 2023, 11:48:44 AM by Humble Bitcoiners
content: AUCTION OF THE LAST 3 ITOKAWA TIMEBANK`SLOT 1: Itokawa #3 in Leaf greenonly 1 made in this color (i call her Cindy Crawford-cause of a tiny beauty mark sitting on the lightning bolt)Starting bid: 0.04 Btc loaded with 0.003125 BtcLOT 2: Itokawa #16 in Claret violetStarting bid: 0.04 Btc loaded with 0.003125 BtcLOT 3: Itokawa #17 in Titanium whiteA special one - coming with a 14k gold number plate on backStarting bid: 0.045 Btc loaded with 0.003125 BtcMINIMUM BID INCREMENT PER LOT: 0.0001BTCPlease limit bids to ONLY 4 decimal placesEND TIME: February 11th, 2023, 5pm New York timehttps://www.timeanddate.de/countdown/zu?iso=20230211T17&p0=179&font=cursiveSNIPE: Any bid made in last 5 minutes PER LOT will extend the auction 5 minutes beyond the ending time PER LOT.If within those 5 extended minutes, a new bid is made, 5 minutes will be added to the auction from the time of that bid PER LOT.Itokawa`s are based at the Miner Jones Headquarter who`s helping out here. Thanks a lot in advance  - Shipping & escrow on buyerINFO ON THE TIMEBANK`S IN ORIGINAL THREAD: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5432900.0Pictures & Videos to show the colors way better - @ItokawaTimebank (Twitter)Happy to answer all incoming pm`s for additional info if needed

comments.author: seek3r
comments.body: Dont miss the chance to get one of the Itokawas in ur hands! I'm also the proud owner of a timebank and can only report that they are even more beautiful in real life than in the photos.Humble, shame on the quality of these photos!  All jokes aside but unfortunately the photos don't really convey the hours of work. Really great pieces...

comments.author: Humble Bitcoiners
comments.body: Thanks for your kind words Seek3r, definitely need a new phone with a better camðŸ˜‚. Best is to watch the @ItokawaTimebank account on Twitter to see how they look in 3D.

comments.author: seek3r
comments.body: Ah shame that no one bid here in the official auction.I feel very sorry for the OP, as it quickly gives the impression that the work is not properly appreciated and there is no interest.Unfortunately you don't see at the first view how much handwork goes into these timebanks - I think you really only realize that when you hold them in your hands yourself.Â  Still, a small success that they could probably be sold privately. I'm curious who can get hold of the last one.

comments.author: anonymousminer
comments.body: Quote from: seek3r on February 12, 2023, 06:18:01 PMAh shame that no one bid here in the official auction.I feel very sorry for the OP, as it quickly gives the impression that the work is not properly appreciated and there is no interest.Unfortunately you don't see at the first view how much handwork goes into these timebanks - I think you really only realize that when you hold them in your hands yourself.Â  Still, a small success that they could probably be sold privately. I'm curious who can get hold of the last one. I grabbed one of these shortly after the auction ended as I missed the end... I was happy that the one I was eyeing was still available.Â  I received it a couple days ago and I can understand how HB has 50+ hours into each piece.Â  The pictures honestly do this piece ZERO justice.Â  I could not be happier to add this into my collection.Â  A well made hand crafted collectible.Â  Thank you HB!!

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: man, cannot believe I missed this, but was traveling  from the 7th until the 14th - I initially wanted to buy #17 but was told it would be auctioned.I see it was sold but I see no bids, what did it sell for? the opening bid amount? if so that was a steal! I really wish I had seen this before leaving.
